task.title: Embed Drawings
task.shortdesc: When you embed a ZWCAD drawing, it becomes part of the other program's document file. When you edit the drawing, you edit only the version that is embedded in the other document.

context.p: Embedding is useful when you don't want to maintain a link to the ZWCAD drawing for the data you include in the other document. Edits made to the new drawing do not affect the original drawing. To transfer the file to other computers, you can transfer all the data in one file, but embedded objects increase the file size.
From within a document in a programthat supports ActiveX, such as MicrosoftÂ®Word, you can either create a new embedded ZWCAD drawing or embed an existing ZWCAD drawing.
To create a ZWCAD drawing in another document

step.cmd: In the document, choose Insert > OLE Object from the main menu.
In the Insert Object dialog box, click Create New to create a new file.
Under Object Type, choose ZWCAD Drawing, andthen click OK.
Choose File > Exit from the main menu in ZWCAD.
To edit the ZWCAD drawing from withinthe document, double-click the drawing.

result.p: TIP You can also embed an existing ZWCAD drawing fromwithin another document.

ol.li: In ZWCAD, select the entities youwant to embed.
Choose Edit > Copy from the main menu (or press Ctrl+C).
Open the document in whichyou want to embed the entities.
Choose Edit > Paste from the mainmenu (or press Ctrl+V).

result.p: To embed an entire ZWCAD drawing

ol.li: Open the document in whichyou want to embed the drawing.
Choose Insert > OLE Object from the main menu.
Click Browse, and then choose the file you want to embed.
Click Insert, and then click OK.
